result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Earl Stokes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Earl Stokes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Justin Earl Stokes.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 10 pages) commencing 07-13-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Justin Earl Stokes in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor; both appear by video.  Defendant Justin Earl Stokes in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
State moves to dismiss Count 2; granted by the Court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Rosquist. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin Earl Stokes not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Justin Earl Stokes in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Justin Earl Stokes in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
